column5: Went out yesterday evening for a quick fish. drifted for a bit and hooked into one. Just as I was going back to anchor another boat came by and anchored very close to where I wanted to be. Went upwind of him and anchored. First cast hooked into another one. About every second cast was rewarded with a pickerel. None of them in the slot.Weather was fantastic, just a slight breeze frrom the northwest.Forty minutes from the time I left the cottage until I got back with my 4 fish. Fresh pickerel for supper tonite.MMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM yum. Sorry no pics, forgot my camera
Enjoy the meal. Sounds like you hit the spot right on. Congrats
Gotta like it, takes longer to drive to the store and back...
Wtg Bernie you must make a check list with the camera on it so we can always see nice pics of them eyes.Mike
What ????    Not even a mouth-watering pic of some well cooked-up fresh fish sittin' on the table ?
All Bull I say !  Love it when someone taking "your" spot helps put you on fish. Well done Bernie and get pouring some more jigs eh...I hear you're running out!!
Bernie  congrats on some nice fish there, im hearing alot of good things from Nip this year so far, hope they tasted good
HEY!!!! Leave some in the lake for me would yah! LOL... Niiiiiiiiiice!   Gerritt.
Thanks for the report. The pickeral were biting well last evening. Unfortunately so were the Mosquitos!

Thanks for the replys guys. I'll take a pic of them when I eat em up for supper tonite  . I was by myself and really wasnt expecting to catch anything so the camera stayed at the cottage. Just so nice out and I worked hard on the boathouse all day and a fishing break was in order. Guess that a pic of them when I got back would have been possible. Nothing big for the contest so it didnt cross my mind to take any.
Way to go..  ...well it cant get any better than that,nothing like getting a limit that quic`k,too bad you didnt get any pics....thanks for sharing     cheers

Good for you Bernie, glad to hear someone is on the walleye. This was my first year in also 20 years that I was skunk for walleye on the openner weekend. Had too many brown pop. I did stop by B.J. Tackle in Bewdley on rice lake and there was a company fishing derby. They weight in 54 walleye by the 2pm deadline. Average size were 4lbs and the largest was around 8.5 lbs.
